result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul N Westlund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow! 
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.
The defendant is placed on a payment plan of $20 a month starting 7/1/22
Seek employment as directed by supervising agent.
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Granted credit for 91 days 
Granted work release

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Paul N Westlund appeared by video means with Attorney.  19CM202,20CM136, 22CM21-- Agreement of the parties as in the offer to settle. Ct finds the def know and vol waives right to be present in the court room. Understands charges and range of penalties, PLEADS NC, signed PLQ, understands elements. admits he is a repater.  Ct accepts pleas, factual basis in the compl, finds the def G on 22CM21 Ct 1, 19CM202, Ct1, and 20CM136 Ct 1 and 4. All other counts in the cases are DRI. State comments on sentencing. Atty comments on sentencing. State complied with vic rights.
